subject: Ethics
title: Treatment of Prisoners of War
description: A quick, practical guide to Treatment of Prisoners of War.

hook.text: A captured enemy soldier is starving and won't reveal troop locations. Can you withhold food?

buildup.text: The Geneva Conventions say POWs must receive food, shelter, medical care, and protection from violence.

discovery.text: POWs only need to give name, rank, date of birth, and service number. That's it. No interrogation tricks.

climax.text: The label you give a prisoner determines their rights. Language becomes a weapon against the powerless.

punchline.text: Change the name, dodge the rules. That's the loophole.
